Subject: SurtPrefixedDecideRule - need a little starter help
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=334689939

I'd like to be able to crawl with the following 4 filters:

1 - Crawl by path (ie. http://sub.example.com/foo/ )
2 - Crawl by host (ie. http://sub.example.com )
3 - Crawl by domain (ie. http://*.example.com )
4 - Free (crawl whatever you find)

Now, it seems that the SurtPrefixedDecideRule should be able to handle 
all these cases.  I'm just unclear on how to go from a seed to the 
correct surt prefix.

Assume we have a seed of: http://sub.example.com/foo/index.html

Its surt form would be: http://(com, example, sub,)/foo/index.html

Are these surt prefixes correct for their respective cases?:

1 - http://(com, example, sub,)/foo/
2 - http://(com, example, sub,
3 - http://(com, example
4 - http://

Please tell me if I have something wrong there.

Assuming I understand that correctly, I'm unclear on how to configure 
the SurtPrefixedDecideRule module.  Specifically, how can I specify a 
particular surt prefix?  I'm assuming that the prefix inferred from the 
seed is the most restrictive (ie. it will always be case 1 in my list 
above).  So, I would like to be able to explicitly set the prefix set. 
I notice there's an option to do this from a file, but can it also be 
done programmatically?  Can I specify it directly?

Alternately, it looks like I could add the specific surt prefix to the 
seed file, and then set SEEDS_AS_SURT_PREFIXES to true.  However, the 
surt prefix in the seeds file would not be a valid URI.  Is that a 
problem, to have invalid URIs in the seeds file?

To sum up, the basic questions are this: do I understand surt prefixes 
correctly, and if so, how do I explicitly specify the desired prefiexs 
to the SurtPrefixedDecideRule?

Thanks,
Micah
